I feel the instant confidence of getting a "3 Kill Streak" on Xbox Live. I felt like I could now become a CoD player, one that doesn't die more than 10 times a Deathmatch. I am then directed to push on my control pad to get extra points. Selfish with confidence I start to push the control pad while oblivious to the player behind me. The other player finds the perfect kill as he pounds me with bullets and I fall to the ground, the confidence washed away and the excuse of the player having a better gun than me falls into my mind.Call of Duty:Black Ops was the whole reason why I went to Best Buy and bought it the day it was released. I was extremely excited to play the long anticipated game but before playing it, I saw the overall review rating on Amazon and it didn't seem like one of my favorite series was doing well.  I didn't want to play Blacks Ops after that, mostly because I didn't want to be disappointed and I had a Kinect review that needed to be finished. After days of Black Ops being in my game shelf, I finally put it in my Xbox and pressed start.Black Ops starts out with "Mason" in a torture room, filled with old fashioned television sets, and a rectangular window with a silhouette of the man who is interrogating Mason. You heard the loud obnoxious voice of the interrogator asking you question after question, things that you as a player don't know about.After questions, Mason will start talking which leads to him remembering his past. Blacks Ops goes on like this till the end when Mason finally finds the truth. The whole storyline never made me look at the time. I was playing mission after mission enjoying the exciting game play that made me like Call of Duty in the first place. I would be driving a motorcycle while shooting enemies, I would be in a "rat" tunnel, ready to shoot the enemies in hiding. Black Ops campaign incorporates great experiences, levels, characters, and more.Black Ops online multiplayer is addicting with so many modes to play in or unlock, it will take me a while to get bored of it. Black Ops online multiplayer is just like the taste I got fromCall of Duty: Modern Warfare 2. But Blacks Ops online multiplayer with Xbox Live does have a few flaws. I get in to matches really fast in Black Ops but find it extremely annoying when I get into a match that has already started. The maps can be very limiting, to someone who playsHalo Reach. The game lobby can also be confusing at first, which makes for a frustrating time adding your controllers to the match.Zombies is my most favorite part of the whole Black Ops. You and 3 other players are placed in locations like the Pentagon or an old Theater. Your main goal is to survive the rounds of zombies. Zombies can also be played online, but makes for a frustration with getting a match, many times the game lobby closes or is "migrating hosts". This frustration with online play downs the experience.Black Ops is still another installment to the series but doesn't rave with me. Black Ops has great same game play, but doesn't seem to stand out in the Call of Duty series. Ops also has mediocre graphics that can't be symbolized as a "stand out".Call of Duty:Black Ops is one great game, it has adventure, great controls, and CoD experiences. But not all of that can hind the mediocre design and more. The game it's self is a must have for anyone who likes Call of Duty but it seem like a whole different game then what the hype was saying. At the end, Black Ops is not fantastic but it isn't a failure.Important UpdateI have had Black Ops since the release date and have been enjoying it, until my game play (missions, zombies) was lost. I don't know how this happened but after I put in Black Ops, it started like I haven't even played the game. After I placed the setting into the game, I checked my Campaign and all my progress (beating the game) was lost. I then just decide to forget about it and play Zombies, unfortunately my zombie progress was lost too. This has never happened to me with a video game before and all I can say is that I am a little disappointed.
summary: Black Ops is not a stand out in the series but still is a great game

reviewText: Being an FPS fan I've of course been following the Call of Duty games since they first appeared on PC. While they haven't been consistantly good, Call of Duty 4 is still one of my favorite all time video games. Now comes the seventh entry in the series (after World at War and Modern Warfare 2). Call of Duty: Black Ops is a very exciting game that excells in story-telling but is weighed down by familiar gameplay mechanics.While the plot's of the Call of Duty games have never been all that impressive, filled with forgetable heroes and villians Black Ops has very well-written characters that bring a very personal feeling to the game's story. No it's not movie worthy (and I'm sure everyone guessed the final twists at the end) but the fact that I actually found myself engrossed in the events of the overall story and the fully voiced player-characters puts this one a notch above the previous Call of Duty games. The voice acting is also terrific with Sam Worthington, Ice Cube, Gary Oldman, and Ed Harris giving real weight to their characters. The music is also very exciting with some great period tracks setting the overall tone of the game.While the story-telling is rock-solid, the actual level designs and basic gameplay of Call of Duty: Black Ops are typical and not very engaging with the exception of a cool prison break level and  one where you're swimming around in Vietnam. Don't get me wrong, no other FPS has quite captured the excitement of the Prypiat, Ukraine missions of Call of Duty 4, but considering this game's called 'Black Ops' you sure do cause a LOT of explosions and get into a lot of gunfights. The basic gameplay is also exactly the same as it was in Call of Duty 4 and even with the 1960's time period the game feels a bit worn-out. Black Ops DOES manage to incorporate some vehicle mechanics into it's gameplay, but even these feel more like arcade shooting moments than actual engrossing experiences (that and they're WAAAAY too brief). The zombie mode is back from World at War and the White House mission is a lot of fun in a tongue-in-cheek manner, but is otherwise identical.When all's said and done Call of Duty Black Ops is more like the ODST to Modern Warfare's Halo 3 (better story, same old gameplay with lots of multiplayer options). It's not an evolution of FPS nor is it really a change to the Call of Duty series in general. Call of Duty Black Ops is a very good game and worth at least a rental (unless you're a multiplayer fan), but lets just hope the next COD takes things in a more unique direction.(a note: I know there's a lot more to Call of Duty Black Ops than the single player campaign and I'm sure you'll have no problem finding a review on here for the multiplayer options. Unfortunatly I'm not a multiplayer gamer so this review is ONLY my opinion of the single player game.)

Believe me, I wanted this game to be on level with the Modern Warfare COD titles, but it simply is not.  It's a decent game, but MW1 & MW2 fans are definitely going to be disappointed.  The graphics in black ops just don't have that crisp, clean look and feel to them like the MW titles. I believe Black Ops is very comparable to Call of Duty: World at War.  However, I will say I found WaW more enjoyable.Single-Player Campaign:  The AI is seriously lacking.  You could be in a foxhole shooting at an enemy, and enemies will continue to go to that exact spot over and over again.  It's simply pushing a button over and over again in the same spot (and there are points in the game where there will be a seemingly endless amount of stupid AI enemies coming to the same spots).  It simply gets boring.Multi-Player:  The first thing I noticed in multi-player was the level design.  There are no "stand out" levels that are especially fun. Do you remember the first time you played the "Crash" level on MW1? A great level design makes all the difference. The levels in Black Ops are mostly forgettable and don't have that attention to detail that you really look for in a COD title. On a positive note, some of the new weapons are cool: the exploding-arrow crossbow, the remote control bomb car.I'm probably going to sell this game back when I'm done with the single-player campaign because I just don't see myself playing the multi-player a lot.  Luckily, I still hold on to a hope that Infinity Ward will crank out a great MW3.

reviewText: I've been a COD fan for a long time now. I've owned every copy since COD 2 and I have to say It's one of the best video games series ever. The only fun thing about this game is that you can customize your player and replays.-Face paint, Camo on your weapons, Clan Tag on your weapons,- Unlock any attachment as soon as you unlock a weapon as you progress through the game, and so on.Which is cool and I do admit it. Single player:  pretty typical game play as the other CoD games.  But there are quite a few weaknesses, mostly in the effects, like a large truck exploding and then shooting across the screen like a rocket, or explosions that look circa 1985 with the fire looking more like sparklers tha flames, or grenades that can hardly be seen or heard when they explode, or a bad ass gatlin machine gun, that you are holding, but that you can barely hear, etc.  Story is just fine and overall game play is fine, but I think there are enough loose ends that it takes away from the game.Multiplayer:  so far it's pretty good, but again different and takes some getting used to.  The players move differently, not as fluidly it seems to me as MW2, and the sound effects are off.  When you run, for example, the sound of your equipment clanking around doesn't sound very realistic and doesn't seem to be in sync with your movements, and then sometimes you'll be running and hear your footsteps, and then all of a sudden you're running in complete silence, yet the ground type hasn't changed.  How that happens I have no idea, but it's odd and very noticeable.  And then your footsteps don't always match with your movements either.  It's quite distracting in my opinion.Graphics:  good, but different than MW2, just like WaW was different.  It's not bad, but after playing MW2 for so long it takes some getting used to.So far I am not highly impressed, but it is a good game overall and I look forward to a lot more online play.  It's worth picking up if you're a fan of the series, but if not, I don't think this is going to change your mind.
summary: Good but it has its weak spots

reviewText: Call of Duty Black Ops is a HIT and MISS game.THE HIT.The campaign one of the best experience's I had with first person shooters, every character tied into the story one way or another and it worked.  Graphics are amazing and COD version of the Cold War wants me to learn everything about it.I felt very involved with every aspect of the campaign and it always kept me at the edge of my seat.A few obvious flaws exist-Constant respawning of the same enemies untill you reach your destination.  You kill one and about 8 seconds later another one come at you from the same spot. Your support is not worth too much, most of the time they shoot at absolutly nothing.-Some temporary indestructible enemies.Biggst one I took notice on was in the vietnamese raid.  There was a vietnam soldier that ran right in front of me with an RPG and I could not kill him with anything I had (M60&AK47;) untill he set himself up and shot his RPG, then I shot him once and he was able to die.So untill certain enemies play their full roll, they will not die. Happens a lot throughout the campaignTHE MISSThe words I have can only express a little of how dissapointed I was when I wanted to shoot this disk till there was no existance of it left.After 1 year of modern warfare 2's relesase and having the best online multiplayer out of any FPS in existance and keeping me hooked to play it over and over again, THIS someone must have been smoking crack when they put BLACK OPS multiplayer together.Multiplayer looks like a cartoon(players-maps-weapons), very sluggish, and it takes forever to get conntected to matches.  MW2 I got conntected in no time.I dont mind going old school with anything from weapons to places to clothes, BUT THIS IS WRONG.Zombie Mode?If you want to go around and shoot zombies get wolfenstien, dead rising, resident evil, etc. instead. The zombies are tough too, but after you eventually get killed and see how many rounds of zombies you lasted through, you would start from scratch all over again.  No leveling up, unlocking weapons no nothing.  It goes nowhere.WARNINGIf you love MW2 Multiplayer, you will not like Black Ops multiplayer one bit.  You will pretty much hate it and go back to MW2 for multiplayer.BLACK OPS IS ALL ABOUT THE CAMPAIGN

reviewText: I'll start off by saying I enjoy the Call of Duty series. COD 4, Modern Warfare 2, even the World At War game wasn't too bad. Not great but not crap either. I bought the new Medal of Honor after seeing the commercials and buying into all the hype and because I was getting a little tired of playing Modern Warfare 2 for almost a year straight. Turns out that overall I didn't care for Medal of Honor (for various reasons) but after playing it the positive points (better graphics and GREAT sound effects) made it hard to go back to playing MW2 again. So where did that leave me? I don't like the Halo games (just because of the theme being space/sci-fi based)so I couldn't get Halo:Reach. I didn't have high hopes for Black Ops because it was made by Treyarch and I haven't really LOVED their additions to the Call Of Duty Franchise. But now that I've played Black Ops for several hours (came in the mail yesterday November 9th, 2010) I can say that I really do like this game (call of duty: black ops) and don't have too many gripes about it. I have only played the multiplayer mode and look forward to playing it for at least a year until the next COD comes out.Some positive points of the game:1.I like the new upgrade system. If you aren't aware how it works I'll try to explain it. In the previous versions of COD you had to wait until you got to a certain level to unlock each upgrade for your weapons. Some of them that you probably didn't even want or ever use(like the shotgun attachment for your assault rifles). In Black Ops you can buy any of the attachments you want for your weapon (once you have access to the weapon that is) as long as you have the points/cash (call of duty points, which you earn during game play, not real money) for it. What's that? You don't want the ACOG for your Rocket Launcher (joke)? Then don't buy it. You don't need one attachment to get to the next attachment. Just so I am clear, you still need to get to certain levels (rank up) in order to have access to different weapons. It's just that now you don't have to rank up just to get all the attachments. You just need the cash :)2.There are lots of new weapons(and lots of familiar weapons from the other games), some new character skills, kill streaks and gadgets to play with that make this game fresh.Some things that could be better:1.Graphics. Medal of Honor (2010) definitely looks better than this game. That being said... I don't know if I would call the graphics on this game worse than Modern Warfare 2 or just different. I have no idea what the creator was aiming for when they made it. I don't have a big problem with the looks of the game. To me the game play makes up for it.2. Sound effects. Again, Medal of Honor DOMINATES this game and all the other war themed games I've played. The sound effects on Black Ops just don't stand out and make you take notice.3. Map size. So far the maps that I've played over several hours (not sure If I played them all or not) seem on the small side and some (nuke house I think it's called) are TINY. That doesn't mean they aren't fun. I would just like to see some really large maps.
summary: Medal of honor sucked? Tired of Modern Warfare 2? This game might be for you

reviewText: I have beaten the Single Player Campaign and played days' worth of multiplayer Xbox live. I simply despise this game in its most basic fashion, everything from the feel to the visuals to the sounds. Now there were a few parts of the game that I enjoyed. However those were separated by such a wide time lapse that they hardly register.Single Player Campaign: I started out with what I thought might have been promise. Shoot Castro in the face, sounds like a good day for any freedom loving American; after though it takes a turn for horrorville. I played this game thinking at some point it's got to get better, but time and time again it only got worse to me. The characters were predictable, the big twist of the game was predictable, and worst of all your character's apparent issues aren't noticed by any of the other NPC's... really? If you have ever seen the Manchurian Candidate then you have played through Black Ops story line.Multiplayer: This is the spot of the game that murdered Call of Duty: Black Ops for me. Even if I didn't like the Campaign mode (I am huge single player video gamer) then the multiplayer can always make up for it. Example: Battlefield: Bad Company 2. Yet they dumbed down the entire experience of this game completely. If you have played Modern Warfare 2 take all of the things you hated to see in Multiplayer and make them easier to get away with in this game. You seemingly have to have zero skill to be good at killing people in this game. Examples are abundant.Lag: There is some intense lag built straight into the Xbox live game play. I have witnessed and recorded on numerous, numerous, and numerous times of my shots traveling straight through a man and causing no damage. (Now when you view your videos in the theater they are pulled off the server not what you viewed on your screen, which is a whole different issue.) Yet I will see an enemy shoot 6 feet to my rear and put me down. Now unless he can bead the space time continuum this is highly improbable. Now once in a while things I have no problem with but this is constant and consistent. You can almost predict infallibly when it is going to occur.Auto-Aim Trash: No Weapon in this game seems to have any kind of realistic recoil. Ok let me take that back, with auto-aim off they do but the online play defaults to auto-aim... really online play with automatic auto-aim. You must be kidding me right? Yet turn auto-aim on and it compensates for the recoil when you are aimed at somebody. So you don't even need skill to pull the trigger responsibly anymore. The only gun I saw with recoil was the M14 (in my opinion the only gun that requires skill to use proficiently.) Put that on top of the Auto-Aim's ability to drag your aim cross screen to rest on an enemy's chest without ever touching the joystick to move and you got a game that does not promote any real need for skill or talent.Additions: This is one part that I truly did like. There is a lot of content in COD: Black Ops that is new and fresh. New guns, optics, gun skins, face paint, Emblem creation, and all that stuff to customize your gun and player card. Yet the only add on I hated was the 1st perk character depiction. You use the Ghost Perk and get to run around with a ghillie suit? That sounds like a formula just begging people to camp in bushes (which there are plenty of) with a fully automatic assault rifle. Also apparently Cold War technology on surviving explosions was way more advanced than modern day. There is no way a point blank C4 explosion should be deflected with a Flak Jacket.Zombies: The only saving grace of this game for me. It is the only reason I ever throw this game into my 360. I play with friends in this all the time and sometimes all day. Yet as soon as I finish with Zombies they move onto MP I take the game out. I am convinced Jesus himself designed Zombies game type. It is excellent.Graphics: 5/10(Really they got worse from MW2? Treyarch how I despise you.)Music: 7/10(Decent music throughout the game. It didnt distract to much but never added that pure epic feel either.)Replayability: 1/10 (For me at least)(Beat it on Veteran the first time through like I do all COD's)Gameplay: 4/10 (Normal game) 10/10 (Zombies)(The controls seem to have been made for the zombie game, not a tactical shooter.)Closing Thoughts: I really don't like it when Treyarch makes COD's. I feel they just capitalize on the money market for COD. The last two COD's Treyarch has put out have been in my op, substandard. World At War was not good to me, because it offered nothing new from 2, or 3. On that subject COD 3... This was an epic waste of time that I wish I had never beaten.

I had very high expectation for this title and enjoy playing it routinely, but only on the Xbox 360. But even there, continual multi-player lock ups and a slew of problems/bugs dampen the fun. If I had a dollar for every time the multi-player aspect locks up or kicks me out of the server usually after achieving some hard to achieve contract, I would own a serious stake in Treyarch. It's beyond frustrating, as is the release of a new set of maps for additional fees prior to fixing the fundamental flaws from release time. Other problems end up occurring in split-screen mode, where I play frequently. Weapons customization slots overlap across player, so if I name one slot Joe's CQB Setup in the first slot under my profile and then my significant other saves her layout in the same position slot and renames it, my custom setup name gets overwritten. Likewise, when I save customized slots, often the settings don't save, and I only realize once I'm in a match that the settings reset to a prior state. This also happens with the screen size (initial setup where you adjust the left/right and top/bottom stretch) and with the controller sensitivity, which randomly seems to reset itself to another setting between matches, so I'm continually having to jump into the options menu between deaths and reset the look-sensitivity. These are all minor nit picks that seem like they would be easy to fix, but when they occur they are so frustrating and mar and otherwise very enjoyable game. Sadly, this continues to reinforce the generally held belief that titles made by Treyarch rather than Infinity Ward in the series are simply not as polished, and that's a real shame.

I'm a big fan of first person shooters, especially the Halo, Battlefield, Call of Duty, and Medal of Honor series. Out of all of them, I have to say, Black Ops is my favorite.The graphics are head and shoulders above the earlier games. The gameplay is smooth, and the story is interesting.I LOVE the multiplayer in black ops! I've played a LOT of multiplayer in the FPS games I mentioned above, and I have to say, black ops feels the most fair and the least affected by latency that I've seen. That's not to say there's not an effect when you have a bad connection, just that it's not nearly as pronounced as in the other shooters.The UI does a good job of communicating appropriate information. It's easy to tell how much latency you have based on a cell-phone like display. There's some gravy like seeing both the count and a map with a lightmap showing where people are playing in the world - I saw more than a MILLION a few days ago! Fun statistics entertain you while scenarios load.There's a number of great maps for multiplayer, and each have strengths and weaknesses for different play strategies. You can pick from a variety of scenarios such as capture the flag, domination, demolition, and free-for-all and team deathmatch modes. Most of the maps are pretty well thought out, and I find myself still learning something new every now and then after several hundred hours of online play time.Obnoxious players are blessedly easy to mute at pretty much any point in the game.Weapons have a nice variety of categories, strenght within category, and attachments. Likewise, you can pick 'perks' which let you do things like run quickly, whip out a pistol for a little payback right before you die, aim more quickly after sprinting, and a plethora of other things. Finding exactly the right combination is a bit tricky, but that's half the fun! For me personally, I like the Aug rifle early on, the Commando rifle later, and the AK47u SMG as soon as you can get it.Pretty much everything in multiplayer rocks. Great game!Pro:- Great graphics- Good gameplay- Great variety of weapons and perks enabling different strategies from stealth to kamikazee- Good variety of maps, yet most are fairly balanced- Online play is excellent, with good latency compensation mechanics, and feels fair.Con:- None I can think of. I love this game!Favorite tips:- don't forget to check out the challenges for 'pro' mode for each of the perks, it really helps. The earlier you pay attention, the better.- SAM launcher kill-streak is one of the most useful!- claymore mines are a nice way to pick up an kills each spawn you manage to live for a little bit.- Favorite load-out for L20+: AK47u w/red dot, LAW or Strela rocket launcher; frag grenade, flash-bang grenade, claymore mine; Perks Ghost, Steady Aim, Last Chance. Kill streaks: Spy Plane, SAM turret, Care Package- Early in the game you get some nice pre-made configs. Don't forget to create your own as soon as you can!- pay attention to the kinds of players in each match. Some will run around willy-nilly. Sometimes you get a team where everyone camps. Adjust your play accordingly or suffer the consequences. If you run around when everyone else is camping, you're entertained because you're constantly being shot up!
summary: Love the multiplayer, like the single player!

reviewText: As the title of the review says, I simply dont understand all the hate for this game.  Its a great game.  The way that the story plays out this time is new, refreshing, and unique.Multiplayer is improved over both W@W and MW2.  No noob tubing losers or knifers.  I refuse to play MW2 online anymore because of that.  Only downside to Black Ops is the spawning.  Sometimes you get a really bad spawn.  They patched it so it happens less, and thats good.  Now it seems to about the same with other games.  No matter what, sometimes you are just going to have an unlucky spawn.Multiplayer is crazy deep.  Contract, wager matches, challenges, new (and better imo) perks.  I love the way that you unlock guns and attachments.  I just wish that CoD points were easier to accumulate in early levels.And then there is Zombie mode.  Whats to say about zombies?  I love killing them.  Chances are YOU like killing them.  It feels that the difficulty has been ramped up a few notches.  Making it past the first dog round is rather challenging.  But, with more and new weapons, weapon upgradability, new zombie enemies, and teleporters (after all everything is better with portals) its a crazy good time for all involved.All in all, I would have to say that this is the finest CoD on current generation consoles (CoD3 doesnt count in that as it was on last gen as well).  Treyarch went big, and I would say they did a pretty damn good job.
Enjoyed the SP campaign immensely, we play the MP over the lan here overseas on a firebase, and that rocks as well.Great game!
summary: Great Single PLayer, Great LAN play!

I'm going to make this short and to the point, unlike most of these reviews that all pretty much same the same thing. This franchise is a yearly event now, surrounded by TONS of hoopla. This game was no different. Breaking sales records that CoD MW2 set last year. However, in my opinion, this game is not much better. I have played it since 1am the Tuesday it came out and my overall opinion is that while it does have some different elements and some worse elements, it also has better ones too. The single player campaign is equal to last years CoD. The graphics are just about on par and the story is exciting. Controls are the same as expected. The online multiplayer is very different in that you must unlock items and then "buy" them with CoD dollars that you earn by playing the multiplayer. There are also wager matches that is actually more fun than the standard play list of free for all, team deathmatch, etc. In wager matches, you put up a specified amount of CoD bucks and you play other types of games, such as "one in the chamber". A game where everyone starts with a knife and pistol with one bullet. If you kill someone, you get another bullet. If you use your bullet, you dont get another until you respawn after dying, or kill someone. There are a few other wager type matches also. As for the bad on the multiplayer, there are lag issues and connection issues. Sometimes it can take 5 min. to connect to a match. However as of 11/14/10, I have read that patches are going to be here very soon to fix these issues. Also, the graphics of multiplayer isn't nearly as nice and polished as MW2. That was a big disappointment to me. One HUGE problem that has been fixed since MW2 is boosters. No longer can you use tactical insertion in free for all. FINALLY! Overall, if you are a fan of the franchise, especially Treyarch, you won't be disappointed. Just don't think that this will be a much better game than MW2, it has its positives and negatives, but overall it is about equal.
summary: Great game, worthy successor to MW2

I'm writing this review from the standpoint of a parent. I really enjoy video games, including all sorts of FPS. I'm a big fan of Modern Warfare, Halo, etc. So I was excited to get my hands on Black Ops.I'm not really into multiplayer, but Black Ops included the ability to add computer bots to multiplayer matches, which, in my opinion, EVERY game should do. With bots I can enjoy good multiplayer action without having to put up with all of the...how do you say 'idiots' nicely?...that you run into in online multiplayer. So that was a real plus.The single-player was an interesting experience, too. I wanted to like it. I really, really wanted to like it. But, like many games seem to be doing these days, I think Black Ops went too far with the content. The general gameplay wasn't so bad, but the single-player campaign contained some extremely violent and disturbing assassinations and such. There really was a lot of unnecessarily gruesome content. Yes, there is an option to turn off excessive gore and profanity, but even with that option on it was more than I ever want my kids to see.So, unfortunately, I had to get rid of it. I enjoyed it while I had it, but the more I played the more I realized it had crossed the line for me. I'm definitely not an anti-violent-video-game crusader, but there is a point where it's just too much.

It is fun to play, it has a lot of the same things everyone loved in MW2.The main issue I have with this game is that it is a bit boring online and the maps are not very interesting either. Compared to games like BF (which has GIGANTIC maps) this game just seems like multiplayer was tacked on as an afterthought. This is the second FPS I have been disappointed by this year (after Medal of Honor).
summary: Don't think of it as a Sequel.

reviewText: It has been a long while since I was deeply drawn into the storyline as this game's campaign has to offer. The story sucked me in deeply due to its mysteries throughout the missions. At first when I played, like the other Call of Duties I thought it was from point A to point B type of game. However honestly it is, but you tend to forget that as you played through your first time fascinated of how the plot of this game is going to fit into history. Within every story mission, especially the first few ones, you tend to believe that you have the power to alter history if your imagination stretched far enough. The fact that the first mission requires you to accomp -lish a certain thing, that tricks you into believing this goes into an alternate resolution of what actually happens in reality. Moving on from apart of the mysteries, the campaign's offers characters that gave you a sense of brotherhood. People who you would have had no problem to fight through Soviet or V.C. headquarters so save them, rushing to them in order to save them faster. Not saving all of the characters will have this effect on you but however a certain three or possibly four may do the trick. I felt like I was in debt with these people and when one dies for a noble cause I was affected by it. Sort of like after watching a Steven Spielberg's movie, where there are some characters where you would like to enjoy ice tea on the shores of Fiji. After when the heat is flushed out, and the sense of a accomplishment purifies the air. Therefore you can imagine what it would feel like when some dies, but that emotion soon passes as everything intensify in the story and makes you realizes that you have a job to finish.Similar to the quote from J.F.K. repeatedly said in the story, "And those who look only to the past or the present are certain to miss the future." The past, in your sense can be interpreted as the as death of your buddies and the future meaning to figure out what is going on in the present and sill happen later on, as the majority of the campaign took place in the past as flashbacks forcing to remember. Near the end was a twist and has amazing effects leading to the end when the feeling of heroism kicks in. Through the perspective of the character you feel like your job has been done, but on the outside the country's job has only begin as you realize it by seeing your surroundings.Then comes the zombie mode, playing as historical political figures like J.F.K. and Fidel Castro was a blast it gave a new feeling to it. Killing massive flocks of zombies with weapons that sounds and looks better ultimately better than World at War. Not saying that the overall appearance and some sounds of the game could have been better looking especially on the computer version. Zombie mode will probably keep me interested for the next two months. Unfortunately the online mode was the most frustrating, this is probably a big factor of why I gave this game three stars. As a veteran of Call of Duty sense the second game, after playing for a week this game gave me a feeling that I was still playing the previous Call of Duty. Even though the new customizations and currency factor was great, but after awhile that doesn't seem to have an affect to keep me continue playing anymore. For those who have had no complaints of the same mechanics of these games it's a perfect game for you.On the other hand I realized who could not blame them... after all it is a Call of Duty game. However now I just keep on getting camped by other players, and sometimes it affects me when I get kill three or four times in a row shortly after spawning. I thought I could overcome that by taking a different route but I soon found myself being overwhelmed. Since my teammates just wanted to run off and get kills on their own, including in objective games. That is the sole reason why I save the objectives games for just my friends and I, for we communicate and work as a team. And teamwork is hard to find on the Xboxlive community when playing with random people. And for some maps they are all great but there are other colors that would have map some of them look more attractive for the environment.Therefore overall I gave this game three stars up mainly do to it's campaign and zombies. However I got bored pretty quickly after playing the online multilayer, as I felt it did not offer me anything special. It's one of those games where I will get back to after watching movies like Platoon where I want to live the action from the movie through the game sometimes.
summary: Campaign Sucks You In Like A Whirlwind!

reviewText: Call of Duty Black Ops is based in the Cold War era. You take on a character who relives scenes such as the Russian Roulette scene in Deer Hunter.It's fair to say that if you've watched any war movies, you've seen all the scenes involved here. You get the Dirty Dozen, Deer Hunter, Platoon, and more. The plots tend to be extremely scripted. You have one way to get through a scene and either you perfect it or you're stuck.The AI definitely doesn't win any awards. Many other games shine in AI, and this isn't it. Don't expect your friends to help out, and don't expect the enemy to think wisely either. You're mostly dealing with fairly simple robots who do what they think they were told to do.The infinite enemies is always something I get annoyed with. It means, if you're stealthy and careful, that you're penalized for being that way. Surely after the 800th enemy they have run out of backup!The voice acting is fairly good, and the video is good. If you're a fan of all those old war movies, which I admit I am, then there's a certain amount of fun being immersed in them. But there's one thing to enjoy being "in the scene" with Robert De Niro. It's another to be there and then annoyed by streams of never-ending enemies stalking at you like zombies.Speaking of which, there's a zombie mini-game in there. I do enjoy mini-games but this one was fairly silly. I suppose it doesn't cause any harm to have it added into the mix. But I wish they'd spent that development time on polishing the main game's gameplay.I'd recommend renting this game first, to see how much it appeals to you. Certainly there's an audience for every game. It could be that this is just what you're looking for. But you're sure to figure out after a day or two if this is tedious for you, or an exciting trip back in time.Rating: 7/10.I purchased this game with my own funds in order to do this review.

First of all let me say that I have played all of the installments of Call of Duty. MW2 was my favorite so far. I received the product at a Gamestop's midnight release. I was happy to find that I could jump online and start playing with people right away. I haven't played the campaign mode, or zombies, so my review will be limited to what I have seen in multiplayer.Connection to games seems a little faster, and more fluid. The actual gameplay had little to no lag. The graphics are a big improvement over World at War (Treyarch's last call of duty). Compared to MW2 the graphics in black ops are cartoonish. The graphics are still amazing, it's just a different feel from MW2. There are some new things added to the gameplay. One is a monetary system that you can use to buy weapon unlocks, perks, and even equipment. Certain levels still have to be attained for weapons (same as MW2), but everything else can be unlocked as you get the money. For example, I was able to unlock the claymore as soon as I had 5,000 points (which happened pretty fast). There is a lot more customization in black ops. Apparently you can change your camo, and even face paint (I haven't leveled up that far yet). The weapons are of the cold war era, but a lot of weapons are showing up again (Famas, M16, MP5, etc.).  The perks are are pretty much the same as well (ghost=cold blooded, second chance=last stand). The kill-streak rewards are also pretty much the same (chopper gunner, bombings, spy plane, care packages). I haven't unlocked it yet, but there is a kill-streak that lets you fly a helicopter, and not just gun. Oh, the pesky dogs are back, and yes they still suck (one bite=dead). The knife is still all powerful (stabbing through hail of gunfire).The multiplayer does seem a lot fresher even though there isn't that much new stuff. It seems quicker, and more fluid. The maps are absolutely astonishing! A lot bigger than MW2, and a lot more detailed. One map has a missile launching in the background. The same game modes are here, but there is one new mode that I noticed. One called wager, where you can wage your points that you earned against others. Whoever wins gets to keep the pot. I have yet to play this game mode, but it seems like a cool idea.Overall I am very happy that I purchased the new Call of Duty. I didn't really like World at War, and in general didn't like the Treyarch versions of Call of Duty. This version is a worthy successor, but I wish there was a little more originality, and new features. At least Zombies has returned for round two, and apparently there is some kind of coop mode, but I am unsure of this.Definitely should be in your library.Update: 11/10/10So I played the campaign for a few hours today; two words: freaking awesome! The storyline is really immerses you, and I'm glad that this storyline is about the cold war. This theme has been remotely explored by some P.C. games, and even fewer console games. The graphics are stunning! I'm ready to put my "Gamerfide" stamp on it.This is the best Call of Duty ever! (MW1 will always be in my heart though)Stop reading; just go out and get it. You won't be sorry.

This game couldn't be a bigger disappointment.The people who only play one or two games in the course of a year: this is for you.  If you care about how a game is crafted, slaved over and tweaked to the best of its ability: this is not for you.  If you still buy Guitar Hero every year, but don't get Rock Band: this game is for you.It is rushed, rugged and not thought through at all.  The sounds are way off, it looks gritty and has no aesthetic properties whatsoever.  The campaign uses ultra-violence to make up for its lackluster graphics and shock value to blanket the shotty story line.  There is almost nothing new to this series.  The playback mode is okay (at best).  You can't even move the camera vertically so you need to move the camera around in circles to get the height you want (please take notes from Halo's use of this tool) and there are no actual bullets flying around.  The in-game credits/money, contracts and wager mode takes away from the addictive leveling-up properties of MW2.I hope all of the 5.3 million who bought this game felt it was worth $65 of your hard earned money (or your grandparents money if you're one the 10 year olds who plague the online multiplayer games with your high-pitched yelling and name calling) because no one wants to waste money.This is completely riding the leftover wave from MW2.  A vast number of players got into the CoD series with MW2 and it smashed all records last year (and for great reasons) and it was smashed again for Black Ops because of Infinity Ward.  Activision pumping out a game every year (to only make money) proves that this series is for the masses.You may have all been duped.

I'm going to keep this short as I can, because there are many reviews of this game already.  I'll just bring up the points I think make this game very good, and the ones that made it very bad.Bad:The hit detection on sniper rifles is downright horrible.  With the Dragunov I can regularly settle the chevron reticle on a stationary character, fire, and hit absolutely nothing.  Sometimes twice in a row.  It's embarrassing.  The L96A1 seems to work better, but if you scope in, quickly track a target perfectly, settle your breathing, and fire--even if your cross hairs were perfectly centered--the game might just ignore it.  Treyarch, if you're reading this: FIX IT.  If I aim at someone and shoot, I expect the bullet to hit, not veer off to the side for no reason.  That's idiotic.  The generally cluttered maps also make it harder to effectively use the sniper rifles, considering one can just use an assault rifle in bursts to much the same effect, and be perfectly suited to close quarters as well.However the teams are set up, it's horribly unbalanced.  I always seem to be in games where either my team is completely destroying the other, or the other team is completely destroying mine.  Close games?  Ha!  Everyone fighting their hardest to keep themselves and their team-mates going to achieve victory?  No.  More like, one team gets a lead and camps out over the map and picks off anyone that runs by until the score limit is reached.Those RC-XD remote control cars with explosives are EVERYWHERE, always.  Sniping on a cliff?  There's one behind you.  About to take a position?  One in front.  How about tucked away in a corner at the edge of the map, laying prone to take a bite of sandwich?  Yeah, it's there, too.Good:All the reasons for "boosting" in Modern Warfare 2 or playing cheaply and most of the ability to do it have been eliminated.  Since gun customization is largely based on what you want rather than "Get 150 head shots for this camo!" you can spiff up your favorite firearm to your liking, and take down the enemies with it.  I especially like my Ice-camo Enfield with my waving Kirby emblem.  Spamming of explosives has been severely cut down with the loss of One Man Army and Danger Close.  Basically it's just a lot less cheap.The single-player campaign is pretty dynamic.  Missions are varied, action is fast and exciting.  Storyline is a lot more aggressive and feels more involving.  Rather than slide transitions with voice-overs to go from mission-to-mission ala MW2, you're much better set up to why and how the next mission is happening.  However as reviewers have mentioned: your team mates are idiots, and the enemies seem to have instant, perfect aim from any given distance.  Honestly, you can be lining up a sniper rifle on someone many yards away and they'll make solid hits on you with a pistol.Additions like the Crossbow, Ballistic Knife, and Tomahawk are fun to play with when you get sick of blasting away all the time.  Though to be fair, the Tomahawk is just a re-skinned Throwing Knife.All in all, I really see Black Ops as just a less cheap version of MW2 with different equipment and a better story.  But that's fine.  I played that game for an obscene amount of hours.One final note to parents considering buying this game for their kids this Christmas: you probably shouldn't.  There are a few quite graphic acts of violence throughout the single player campaign.  One notable incident is of the player character sawing through the neck of a Viet Cong soldier with the serrated back of a combat knife.  I know Vietnam was supposed to be an especially grim, unforgiving, and tragic war--and that act (along with the general feel of the Vietnam missions)--sets that up well, but it's not for kids.  Seriously, there's an MA rating on the box for a reason.  It's for mature gamers.

reviewText: Don't really play video games, but this game is a great game and it really keeps persons who play glued to the tv for hours.

Initially, and compared to the terrible Gears Of War series, I really liked this game. It was a breath of fresh air to actually feel I had some degree of control over my on screen character, and could actually engage other players on equal terms. After playing for a while though, that illusion soon vanished. Black Ops suffers from poor hit box detection, and the usual lag issues associated with peer to peer gaming. On top of the actual issues with the game mechanics, the game suffers from a limited number of maps that soon become dull, and not sure if there is map rotation issue, but some maps seem to appear time and time again. Expect to play a lot of WMD and Array. I think it says a lot about the quality of the maps, that when presented with the two possible choices, players will always vote for a random map, anything other than the ones they have been presented with. The only maps that players do seem to vote on are Nuke Town and Firing Range. The maps are also pretty small, so the sniper class seems redundant. This is little more than a gun and run game.Gun selection in this game is pretty much all eye candy, and really makes no difference at all. You can still shoot someone point blank with a shotgun any number of times and they will not go down, and firing on a person first is no sure guarantee that they will be killed. I particularly like the way as well that 50% of the time, enemy players can stroll past your claymore, which will then detonate well after you have been killed by said player. Oh, and watch out too for the poorly animated dog attacks. The blurb says a well timed knife attack can kill a dog, however, there are so few frames of animation on the dogs attacks, that one minute it is on the floor, the next it is on you! Oh, and speaking of knives, expect to be knifed by another player a few feet past them.Whack Ops may be fun if you have come from an even poorer game, in my case, the Gears Of War series, but at the end of the day, get ready for BS and WTF moments aplenty.
summary: BS and WTF moments a plenty!

reviewText: Good:Decent graphicA few single player levelsMP for playing with friendsBad:Bad campaign checkpoints (getting killed by nothing only to restart and die instantly over and over)Error: Error dogj for xmodel 'c_rus_spetznaz_body2_g_rarmoff' has more than 160 bones (see console for details) (got this error at the end of a level and had to restart the whole level)The hit detection is horrible (can kill the enemy without actually hitting them)Most of the MP (poor hit detection, bad gunplay, etc)Easy even on hardThe graphics are a step backwards.I had only died a few times during the campaign (on hardest setting) but 2 of those times I died from nowhere.  Once, I died after downing a heli.  The heli crashed and smashed the enemy that was left before turning the corner.  About a second later a rocket came through the heli.  Yep, actually through it.  It killed me instantly.  I restart in the exact same spot and the rocket is there again.  I die instantly.  Did this about 6 times trying to shoot a grenade right when is restarted but did not even have time to shoot.  I had this happen in another spot where I was dying in an empty room.  Apparently a leftover bullet from an enemy or something (the area was clear and I had just received a checkpoint).  When I died it restarted, only to die again.  And this has happened to my son a few time also.  Not in the same spot.  Had to exit to the menu and reload to make it stop.This game it definitely not the best Call of Duty.  Easy, yes.  But the campaign is a mess and in my opinion pretty dumb.  The story is full of situations where you almost die but get lucky and live. First and foremost, I gotta say I'm a fan of FPS in general, everything from MW2 to Metro 2033, I enjoy playing them all.  That being said I was excited for a new CoD, even though I was a bit skeptical; admittedly I wasn't a fan of CoD:WaW.I signed into XBL, and saw almost half my friends list playing CoD:BO, this doesn't mean much though most people jump on the newest games right away.  I started the game up and went into MP with a few friends, immediately I noticed the pixelated image while loading a map...I didn't pay much attention and waited for the game to start.  This is where my first bit of disappointment set in.  The guns look terrible in my opinion, little to no detail aside from a patch of rust here and there.  The details are extremely lackluster, looking like they copied and pasted right over from WaW.I set aside the graphics for awhile and started running around, the second disappointment was easily heard.  The sound in this game cant compare to the fantastic sound effects in MW2.  Foot steps all sound the same, like your running in a mucky swamp, when on screen its actually pool side at a villa. Grenades sound like poofs, and barely give my sub-woofers a chance to create the rumble.  Gunshots are mediocre at best, I just don't get the crack of the guns like other games I've been playing.  All in all I'm pretty much let down at this point.I must say the gameplay, the bread and butter of any video game is pretty decent.  I can let the graphics and sound off in there lack of wow factor, much like Treyarch did apparently.  I ranked up to a level 14, and had a pretty good time doing it.  The guns seem to actually kill enemies this time around, instead of allowing them to run around the corner after half a clip.  The perks are nice, and the upgrade and money system seems to be really nice, and different.I upgraded my M16 with a few goodies including; flamethrower, ACOG sight, grenade launcher, and a suppressor.  Purchased claymores which thank you Treyarch you can now MOVE!  Overall the online action is non-stop, which is a good thing for a FPS.  The ability to purchase upgrades at your own pace and preference is nice, and you notice not everybody is running around with a UMP, with commando and stopping power.I'm hoping to start a bit of the single player game this weekend (looks like snow and rain) so hopefully that impresses me a bit more than the things I mentioned above.If your a diehard fan of Call of Duty, especially Treyarch's versions definitely pick Black Ops up, its a decent game, and more than likely you'll get your money's worth from the MP and zombie modes alone.

I will keep this short and simple:1)  The multiplayer is more balanced.  Small changes and tweeks have left multiplayer a more level playing field.  Less devesating kill streaks, shotguns as primary weapons only, the list goes on.2) The Campaign is enjoyable more so than MW2, which I also liked.3) Stats - Multiplayer has complete breakdowns of your multiplayer perfromance.  Efficiency with certain weapons, what weapons kill you, your productivity in the last five rounds, where you hit your opponents, heat maps showing were all the peopler were killed in a match.

Treyarch really stepped it up in this iteration of the COD franchise. I have enjoyed it just as much as the previous Modern Warfare 2. And Treyarch managed to give it their own feel and look, it is definitely not just a re-skin.
summary: BLOPS is an excellent continuation in the series!

Being a fan of the Call of Duty series, and  having played COD since the days of the first call of duty back in 2003. I was a little worried about the fact that it was no longer being develop by Infinity Ward (the devs of Modern Warfare 2)  instead Treyarch. Developers of the dismal "world at war" installment. But having played Black Ops for a couple of days i can say that this is a big improvement over Modern Warfare 2. Which WAS the best FPS of all time until nowThe single player is not really BO's strong point. The AI mostly just stands there or charges at you like a rampaging horde. Their are times when my AI controlled members of my team, ran right past an enemy and didn't even fired and their were also times when i just happen to be standing next to an enemy and the guy didn't know i was there. Thankfully though, the weak AI isn't a game spoiler and the game is indeed challenging at some points. That is if you remember to turn off the auto aim feature  in the options menu. I do enjoy the whole story of a covert secret ops team working for the CIA. Which is told mostly through flashbacks from the main character. Their are some excellent cut scenes which are similar to those in "World at War" shown in between each mission. The entire look of the classified files, meshed in with film clips of the 1960's cold war as well as main character Mason's own memories just adds to the suspense.. Just try not to get a seizure while watching them. Fans of World at War can also expect some cameos from several of the Russian characters.Multiplayer is the beard and butter of the COD franchise and BO's is one the best on the market. The rules work similar to that of earlier COD games but instead of just working up experience points, you are awarded in game currency to purchase equipment, guns, killstreaks, and perks. Thus allowing you to work right away at creating your specs. Of course, some of the equipment and guns will still have to be unlocked over the course of time. Some of the most biggest complaints of the previous COD games has been addressed. No juggernaut, no scavenging claymores allowing you to camp, noob tubing isn't as bad as before, no game ending Nukes, as well as kill streaks not being the spawn camping nemesis they were in the MW2. It is a much better experience this time around. Some may be relieved for the changes to multiplayer while others may find it not to their liking.  I myself like it. Wager matches are a great way to break up the monotony of an online FPS. As well as earn money faster.Graphics  and music are movie quality. In fact Black Ops was actually produced with the same techniques as in the movie Avatar. This really sticks out in the Nam mission in which you can see even the smallest details of facial features. It almost makes me want to buy a 3D TV. I did notice that Treyarch reused the old "URRUH" chant from it's previous game as well as recycling other sounds. I only encountered one bug in the game so far in which i just simply killed myself and went to the last checkpoint.
summary: The 800 pound gurilla of first person shooters

I'm not going to go into too much detail since I've seen that other reviews have already covered a lot, but so far the game seems to be a huge improvement over MW2. Part of the reason might be just because I got bored of MW2, but I do believe that this game makes improvements.I've seen people posting that it's the same game as MW. Well first of all, it's a completely different game: different maps, characters, story, weapons, perks, challenges, killstreaks...etc. I don't know how that's the same game as MW, but let's just say that it is the same game...is that a bad thing? MW is one of the best games in the genre and looking like MW and playing like MW isn't a bad thing. To say that Treyarch didn't make something unique is just stupid.They've kept similar core concepts to the game with a few exceptions:1) They've balanced the weapons more fairly2) They've made the killstreaks a little less devestating. They're still cool, but they don't allow you to completely dominate the other team as easily as in MW23) They added cool new perks; camera you can leave is really cool ideaThe graphics are could be considered inferior to MW, but I actually think that in some ways they're better. The framerate and some of the smooth textures seem to be lacking, but the level of details and the overall look of the maps is really intricate and just awesome I think. If you played WAW then you know that Treyarch has a different way of doing the visuals, but they're still pretty sweet. So, I'd say that they're different but not necessarily inferior to IWs visuals.I haven't played enough of this game to say that it's the game of the year yet, but my first impressions are that it's an improvement on MW2 and it's definatly the game I've been waiting for. If you read the one star reviews and decide not to pick this up then you're really missing out on a fun time. If you loved the other COD games and you like the old Vietnam error weapons and themes, then this game should be a lot of fun for youUPDATE:I've played a lot more of the multiplayer now so I'd like to make a few comments:1) The contract system is really cool. You'll have to stay on top of your contracts to maximize your potential for earning upgrades, but it really makes the matches a lot more fun. I've always got three different contracts going on, so I can earn extra points towards weapon and perk upgrades. (contracts are a way of gambling to complete tasks with your virtual currency and you can make extra cash if you complete the challenges in a set amount of game time.)2) I'd like to touch on the graphics again. Most of the levels are just stunning to me. If anything, I think they look and feel better than previous MW games. The level of detail and lighting effects are fantastic. There's also a lot of interactive things happening in the maps that can cause enemies to die or give you advantages. In one of the stages, a rocket launches...pretty fun to watch if your enemies aren't giving you too much of a challenge.3) Being able to upgrade your weapons and choose your perks is awesome. I've made my SMG and assault rifle really sweet now using the virtual currency and it's great to earn extra doing contracts.4) They have a world map similar to the one that was in Halo that shows you all the lights on the globe where people are playing...there's no one playing in Madagascar...that's too badCons:Matchmaking is severely broken as of now. I'm sure they'll fix it as soon as possible, but right now if you have a party bigger than three people, you'll probably have trouble joining games. Some of these issues may be related to moderate or strict NATs, but since it doesn't tell you what your NAT settings are in the game, we weren't 100% on that. You can always check through the Xbox network settings and if your NAT settings are not open, you may need to enable DMZ or port forward...just do a google search.Also, connections are showing up 3 or 4 green bars, but there still seems to be significant lag in some of the levels. This varies from match to match and I'm confident that they should be resolving it soon.The more I play this game, the more I love it. I'm really shocked to see so many negative reviews. I guess expectations were really high for this and there's a lot of haters out there.
summary: You've played the rest, now try the best

reviewText: Call of Duty Black Ops is a good game in a great series of games.  Some fans of the series might be put off by the lackluster AI or the fact that you can only play Co-op in the Zombie Mini-game, but this is still a good buy if you like the series and you want to take advantage of the Online VS. Modes.Concept:  10/10Black Ops is the latest installment of the Call of Duty Series.  There is a 6 hour Campaign with 4 Difficulty Levels, a Single Player / Co-op Zombie Game similar to Left 4 Dead, and Multiplayer with Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch, Capture the Flag, and Blow Stuff Up Objectives.  There is an awful lot of gaming crammed onto this disk!Story:  8/10You are Mason, voiced by Avatar's Sam Worthington, and you begin the game being "roughly interrogated" by the CIA.  The fate of the free world is at stake and the only way to save it is to crack a code that has been imbedded into your subconscious.  Mason recounts his adventures with the Black Ops during the cold war and you play through them.  The story is vastly improved over Call of Duty Modern Warfare 2 (Which isn't saying much because that game made as much sense as Transformers 2.)Graphics: 9/10The Call of Duty series is known for its stunning graphics and intense gameplay.  Black Ops delivers, yet again.  Although, I remember the Modern Warfare games looking just a bit better, Black Ops still looks great.  The backgrounds and visual effects are very well rendered.  Normally, I'd say, "The graphics pull you into the action," at this point...  Keep reading.Gameplay: 7/10Most of the game has you running through missions as part of a squad, going from checkpoint to checkpoint as exciting things happen all around you.  You have an arsenal of guns and grenades at your disposal.  The weapons are well balanced and feel great.  However, the AI definitely needs more work.  In the Call of Duty series, you don't need super complex AI because characters die so quickly, they aren't onscreen very long.  However, the AI characters need to do a much better job at convincing the Player that he or she is in a war.  There were too many times in the Campaign where Viet Cong and US Marines simply stood next to each other like co-workers at the water cooler talking about last night's game.  Issues like this break the immersion of a battle and the game quickly devolves into an ultra loud shooting gallery.Level Design:  7/10There are combat missions, stealth missions, and vehicle missions where you destroy things and progress to clearly marked checkpoints.  Most of the missions in the game are intense and exciting, but there are a few that are far from great.  Infinitely spawning enemies and counter-intuitive checkpoints ruin the fun.  Once this starts happening, you feel like saying, "Ok, Designer Guy, what do you want me to do?"  Instead of feeling like you are fighting in actual battles.  There are 4 different Difficulty Modes for the Campaign and it should take you about 6 hours to complete it.Sound:  10/10Great Voice Acting + Loud Explosions and Gunfire = 10!The sound is so good, my neighbor complained about the noise!If that's not a ringing endorsement, I don't know what is.Zombies:  6/10Black Ops also features a fun little Zombie game where you are in a building that is under attack by waves of zombies.  You set up barricades and kill them to earn points.  You use those points to buy better weapons or open doors to expand the level.  This is a fun little mini-game that feels a bit like Left 4 Dead.  People either play it a few times and quit, or get hooked.  To progress past level 5 in the game, you have to be a great gamer or you need some good old fashioned Co-op teamwork.Multiplayer:  8/10The Multiplayer Modes are back and there are plenty of them.  Black Ops feels well balanced and the upgrade system allows you to purchase weapons and customize your gear.  The maps and gameplay feel really solid and it's always satisfying to shoot someone online.  The Call of Duty Kill Streaks are back, allowing Players to wreak havoc on the map as a reward for killing sprees.  Call in spy planes, assault choppers, mortar strikes, napalm...  The Multiplayer Modes are typically fun for the competitive gamers.Maturity:  MThere are some intense scenes of violence in this game, so it's definitely not for kids.Although, when I play online, I swear half of the people with microphones are 12.Overall: 8/10Call of Duty Black Ops is not the best in the series, but it's definitely fun.  If you want a great looking, intense, shooting gallery, with some multi-player modes, you will enjoy this game!Buy it if you want a decent Campaign with a Good Story and you want to take advantage of the Multiplayer Modes.Rent it if you only want to play through the Campaign.  You can do this in 1 or 2 days.Avoid it if you hate violence, explosions, testosterone, swearing, and killing.
Multiplayer is tops, campaign was actually really strong as well. Zombie mode is addictive. If you like CoD games, you'll enjoy this as well.
summary: A CoD game with a great story to boot!

reviewText: So I'm one of those few people that still buys video games for the story and single player campaigns first and multiplayer second. I probably will take quite some time before I actually play this game online with others, if ever, so I cannot review that aspect, what I can review is the single player and as far as that goes this game is pretty solid.The plot elements of Black Ops are way up there, the story is just fantastic. It has a mystery to it that the main character doesn't really know what's going on and they do an awesome job of making it feel like you are right there in his shoes. It actually had 1 moment where I was pretty darn sad (WAW fans may feel what I am saying on this one.) 5 stars thereGraphics wise it has really awesome moments, the cinemas are really cool and some of the vehicle chases are just outstanding, but it really is nothing new as far as the COD franchise goes and isn't quite up to par with IF's MW2. So 4.5 Stars there.Gameplay is pretty standard as far as any 1st person shooter is concerned. There are some really cool stealth sections though and again the vehicle escapes are fantastic. My main problem though is that it seems a little glitchy. I have a friend who also has the game that says he has moments where he can't move his gun at all and while I personally have not had the I have had issues with the AI characters not going where they are supposed to or not moving at all. It only gets super frustrating when those characters have to follow or at least get to where you're going in order to progress through the level. Hasn't happened a lot but it is aggravating. only 4 stars thereI'm not burning through the game as i want to make the campaign as long as possible but I imagine it is going to only net 7 hours of gameplay on regular difficulty. As far as that goes though it doesn't really bother me because I already know I will play through the campaign quite a few more times. For all of the guys saying MW2 is so much better I really have to bring it back to gameplay time there too, only 6 hours regular. All FPS's now are going away from long campaigns and focusing on the multiplayer so really it's nothing to say that this game is a piece of crap when you say how awesome MW2 is having the same short campaign time. 4 StarsMy favorite COD game thus far has been WAW so I may be a little biased here but I think Treyarch did a really good job overall and I would rate Black Ops a 4.5 overall.

reviewText: There's 3 things stopping this game from being perfect. One thing is the HORRIBLE spawning system. I hear that Treyarch is working on it though, so hopefully, it'll be fixed soon via patch.The 2nd thing would be the Hardline Pro glitch. I don't exactly know what it is, but I think that it lets you do care package all day. You can tell if someone is doing the glitch if they have some insane stats after the match. I played a match where a guy had 67 kills & 6 deaths...-_-. Really? That needs to be fixed IMMEDIATELY!Lastly, this prolly won't be a problem to some, but it annoys me SO much. There's 14 maps in total, & I only like 4 of them, cause they don't promote camping. I only like Launch, Firing Range, Nuketown, & 1 other map that I forgot the name of. On all the other maps, all people do is camp & wait for someone to come by so they can get a kill. It's SO annoying to me. It's ESPECIALLY bad on Havana. That map's absolutely the worst to me. People camp ALL DAY on that map.If these things gets fixed, I would give them game a 6/5 rating.

You know the old saying... if you've seen one, you've seen them all?  Well that sure applies to the call of duty series.  Every game after modern warfare 1 seems like a COD add-on mission pack, same engine, same old arcade style shoot-em-up action, only thing different between MW 1, 2, 3, World at War and now these Black Ops games is the maps.  The enemies all act the same, the guns all feel the same...no innovation whatsoever.  I'm not trying to insult fans of this series, COD is like a religion to some those gamers and I'm sure I'd be accused of blasphemy.  Activision has found a product that makes them a lot of money and I can't really blame them for churning out more of the same because people keep on buying it.  But I'll never buy another COD game again unless they come up with something really new and innovative, but as long as people keep shelling out the bucks for this crap, that will probably be a long time from now.

I've been a fan of the Call of Duty games for quite awhile. Modern Warfare 2 was a great game, but it's online multiplayer mode had a few annoyances. Black Ops has remedied those annoyances and gives players a highly polished and extremely fun multiplayer experience. I own this game for both the PS3 and the XBox 360 and I do have to admit that the multiplayer portion of the game seems to play much better on the Xbox. The PS3 version suffers from occasional frame rate issues and frequent disconnects. I've had no frame rate issues and virtually zero connection problems on the 360.The single player mode is just about what you'd expect from this series; it's not the best story line in the world, but that action is fun and there are a variety of missions to keep it feeling too repetitive.The zombie mode is a huge plus and I'm glad to see it also had been improved and enhanced greatly since COD World at War. It's so much fun. It's probably the most fun I've had playing with friends in a long time. It's just a humorous and laid back mode of playing and it's as challenging as it is fun.I'd say that if you've been happy playing the Modern Warfare versions of this game, you'll be thrilled to play Black Ops.
summary: COD franchise takes a step forward

Hopefully you know by now, but if you're interested in Black Ops for playing 4 player split screen with a bunch of friends like we did for years on the previous generation of consoles, you're out of luck.First off, the much hyped Offline Combat Training mode is hidden in the ONLINE menu.  What this means is that you need an active XBOX Live Gold account to access the mode.  So yes, you need internet access and an online gold account to play against bots.  Annoying to say the least.Far more annoying to me is that Combat Training (to play solo or versus friendS according to Treyarch) is limited to two players split screen.  So I bought the game with the hopes of playing four player split screen vs the bots or Zombies, to find out that it's not an option.The only OFF line four player split screen options are modes with all guns, etc... unlocked, no leveling up system, and absolutely NO BOTS.  It's decent, and having searched more I've found a few articles published days before release that clarified what Treyarch and Activision had purposely deceived consumers into believing.The campaign is okay.  Some really cool moments, but I can only play for about 30 minutes before I get tired of just laying waste to thousands of mineless enemies.  Online mulitplayer takes some getting used to.  It plays slower and different than MW2.  The level design is good.  They seem to be getting the match setting system resolved.  The first week it was near impossible to get into a game in under five minutes.Overall, a decent game.  I'm keeping it, but I'll probably let my brother borrow it most of the time.  It's just not really worth $60.  Or maybe it is and it was just way oversold and I thought I was getting something that I just wasn't.  Sadly, the offline multiplayer was what pushed me to buy it, when, like many of us, I don't really have a lot of money laying around.  I expected it to be great entertainment for a group and it is, but only for about an hour, not the 4-6 hours we used to waste on other split screen multiplayer games.
summary: No Internet, No Game.  Most Offline content only available ON-LINE.

reviewText: People buy this game for multiplayer and that's where it fails.  You can upgrade weapons perks to a "pro" status.  In most cases this is a waste of time.  The only perk that's worth upgrading is hacker pro.  And the programming of the game is awful.  Yesterday I played demolition.  Well some kids from Canada would camp at the spawn points and kill people as they spawned in.  In fact one guy would knife people in the back as they spawned in one foot away from him.  The shotguns in the game are worthless.  Explosive rockets aren't as deadly.  And overall graphics for the game are a real stepdown from MW2.  And so are the maps.  While this COD did away with "no scoping", no one really snipes anymore because you can't replenish claymores and very few maps which have good sniping points.  The care packages are a joke.MW2 was a far superior game, but they did nothing to stop hackers.  I won't be buying anymore COD games.  I will be returning the Black Ops game I bought for a friend.Update:Well the game is flooded with hackers.  You can't compete unless you cheat.  Activision doesn't care.  I'm selling my game on ebay.  No more COD.  Activision refuses to deal with cheating.

.::REASONS FOR THE 2 STAR REVIEW::.:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::- Single Player campaigns babysits the gamer with short checkpoints - no penalty for failing the mission- STUPID AI - Stop standing next to the enemy doing nothing!!- Single Player campaign is short- Multiplayer Maps are boring- The guns are completely unreliable ...or I should say the hit boxes are atrocious- There aren't any guns you look forward to playing with - they range from sucky to complete crap- Some of the assault rifles are really SMGs now- EXAMPLE:  no SMG puts out more RPM than the FAMAS, tied yes, more no- Only one 3-round burst gun (M16)- The Crossbow with detonating darts replaced the noob tubers- Tomahawk with a broad hit box replaced the knifers- Some perks require certain game modes to get PRO - lame- Only two spawn locations - VERY EASY to spawn rape the other team on some maps- Last Stand/Chance still in game- Claymores don't replace grenades, so they're everywhere- Claymores don't blow up the person who laid them- Claymores will sometimes not kill the enemy if they stop moving- Better hit rates with hip fire spray than ADS- Stat Trackers, though GREAT idea, are bugged and give false data- Game breaks up parties when attempting to join games on XBL- Game gives false error messages when it won't allow you to join your friend's party.::AWESOME IDEAS ALL FPS GAMES SHOULD HAVE::.:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::- Being able to view your last 100 games and bask in your awesomeness- Being able to record bits and pieces from those games- File share- Being able to buy gun attachments instead of waiting for a kill count- User custom titles and emblems ...honestly I enjoy dorking around with my title more than the game- Custom reticles are fun to play with- Easy access to CoD player cards- Functional and quick menu structure- Stat Trackers for the game lobby ...so you can see how good people are overall (currently bugged)- Wager Matches are awesome- Overall best selection of Game Modes I've seen in a FPS game- Better killstreaks than MW2- Storyline from the single player campaign is interestingOverall I really enjoy the new features BLACK OPS added into the game and if it wasn't for those and the fact my friends keep hounding me to play with them I would have gave up on BO long ago.  In fact, when they aren't online I go back to old games.  This game has a lot going for it that makes me want to love it but it seriously fails in the two areas I need the most in a good FPS game - maps that make you stay up longer than you should and awesome guns that you want to keep using.  If the hitboxes weren't so awful and it had at least 1 gun I could trust I could see myself liking this game and playing it awhile.
